member.name: T:ActiveDirectoryWrapper.My.Resources.Resources
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: P:ActiveDirectoryWrapper.My.Resources.Resources.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:ActiveDirectoryWrapper.My.Resources.Resources.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: M:ActiveDirectoryWrapper.ADWrapper.ExtractUserName(System.String)
member.summary: Function to extract just the login from the provided string (given in the format AMBASSADORSGROU\Firstname.Lastname)
member.param: Full AD login of the associate

member.summary: Method to add a user to a group
member.param: Group name (in string formation) to search and ultimately add user to

member.name: M:ActiveDirectoryWrapper.ADWrapper.CreateAdAccount(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Procedure to create a new Active Directory account

members.member: Helper method that sets properties for AD users. DirectoryEntry to use Property name to set Value of property to set
Method to set a user's password DirectoryEntry to use Password for the new user

member.name: M:ActiveDirectoryWrapper.ADWrapper.EnableAccount(System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntry)
member.summary: Method to enable a user account in the AD.

member.name: M:ActiveDirectoryWrapper.ADWrapper.de(System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntry,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Helper method that sets properties for AD users.

member.summary: Procedure to create a new Active Directory account

member.summary: Method that disables a user account in the AD and hides user's email from Exchange address lists.
member.param: Login of the user to disable

member.summary: Establish identity (principal) and culture for a thread.

member.summary: Function to query the Active Directory and return all the computer names on the network
member.returns: A collection populated with all the computer names

member.summary: Function to return all the groups the user is a member od

member.name: M:ActiveDirectoryWrapper.ADWrapper.IsAccountActive(System.Int32)
member.summary: This will perfrom a logical operation on the userAccountControl values to see if the user account is enabled or disabled. The flag for determining if the account is active is a bitwise value (decimal =2)

member.name: M:ActiveDirectoryWrapper.ADWrapper.RemoveUserFromGroup(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This will perform the removal of a user from the specified group
member.param: Username of the user to remove

member.name: M:ActiveDirectoryWrapper.ADWrapper.Login(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This method will not actually log a user in, but will perform tests to ensure that the user account exists (matched by both the username and password), and also checks if the account is active.

member.name: M:ActiveDirectoryWrapper.ADWrapper.IsUserValid(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This method will attempt to log in a user based on the username and password to ensure that they have been set up within the Active Directory. This is the basic UserName, Password check.

member.name: M:ActiveDirectoryWrapper.ADWrapper.GetUsersinGroup(System.String)
member.summary: This method will return all users for the specified group in a dataset

member.name: M:ActiveDirectoryWrapper.ADWrapper.GetAllGroups
member.summary: This method will query all of the defined AD groups and will turn the results into a dataset to be returned

member.name: M:ActiveDirectoryWrapper.ADWrapper.GetUser(System.String)
member.summary: This will return a DirectoryEntry object if the user does exist

member.name: M:ActiveDirectoryWrapper.ADWrapper.GetUser(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Override method which will perfrom query based on combination of username and password This is used with the login process to validate the user credentials and return a user object for further validation. This is slightly different from the other GetUser... methods as this will use the UserName and Password supplied as the authentication to check if the user exists, if so then the users object will be queried using these credentials.s

member.name: M:ActiveDirectoryWrapper.ADWrapper.GetDirectoryObject
member.summary: This is an internal method for retreiving a new directoryentry object

member.name: M:ActiveDirectoryWrapper.ADWrapper.GetDirectoryObject(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Override function that that will attempt a logon based on the users credentials

member.name: M:ActiveDirectoryWrapper.ADWrapper.GetDirectoryObject(System.String)
member.summary: This will create the directory entry based on the domain object to return The DomainReference will contain the qualified syntax for returning an entry at the location rather than returning the root. i.e. /CN=Users,DC=creditsights, DC=cyberelves, DC=Com

member.name: M:ActiveDirectoryWrapper.ADWrapper.GetDirectoryObject(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Addition override that will allow ovject to be created based on the users credentials. This is useful for instances such as setting password etc.

member.name: M:ActiveDirectoryWrapper.ADWrapper.GetLDAPDomain
member.summary: This will read in the ADServer value from the web.config and will return it as an LDAP path ie DC=creditsights, DC=cyberelves, DC=com. This is required when creating directoryentry other than the root.

member.name: M:ActiveDirectoryWrapper.ADWrapper.GetProperty(System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntry,System.String)
member.summary: This will retreive the specified poperty value from the DirectoryEntry object (if the property exists)

member.name: M:ActiveDirectoryWrapper.ADWrapper.GetProperty(System.DirectoryServices.SearchResult,System.String)
member.summary: This is an override that will allow a property to be extracted directly from a searchresult object
